definitions.text: 1. consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning.
definitions.example: analyse a sonnet by Shakespeare , analyse the evidence in a criminal trial , analyse your real motives

definitions.text: 2. break down into components or essential features.
definitions.example: analyse today's financial market

definitions.text: 3. make a mathematical, chemical, or grammatical analysis of; break down into components or essential features.
definitions.example: analyse a specimen , analyse a sentence , analyse a chemical compound

definitions.text: 4. subject to psychoanalytic treatment.
definitions.example: I was analysed in Vienna by a famous psychiatrist

definitions.text: 1. ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation.
definitions.example: his approach to every problem is to draw up a list of pros and cons

definitions.text: 2. the act of drawing spatially closer to something.
definitions.example: the hunter's approach scattered the geese

definitions.text: 3. a way of entering or leaving.
4. the final path followed by an aircraft as it is landing.
5. the event of one object coming closer to another.
6. a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others.
7. the temporal property of becoming nearer in time.
definitions.example: the approach of winter

definitions.text: 8. a close approximation.
definitions.example: the nearest approach to genius

definitions.text: 9. a relatively short golf shot intended to put the ball onto the putting green.
definitions.example: he lost the hole when his approach rolled over the green

definitions.text: 1. move towards.
definitions.example: We were approaching our destination

definitions.text: 2. come near or verge on, resemble, come nearer in quality, or character.
definitions.example: His playing approaches that of Horowitz

definitions.text: 3. begin to deal with.
definitions.example: approach a task , approach a new project

definitions.text: 4. come near in time.
definitions.example: Winter is approaching , approaching old age

definitions.text: 5. make advances to someone, usually with a proposal or suggestion.
definitions.example: I was approached by the President to serve as his adviser in foreign matters

definitions.text: 1. a particular geographical region of indefinite boundary (usually serving some special purpose or distinguished by its people or culture or geography).
definitions.example: it was a mountainous area

definitions.text: 2. a particular environment or walk of life.
definitions.example: it was a closed area of employment

definitions.text: 3. a subject of study.
definitions.example: it was his area of specialization , areas of interest include...

definitions.text: 4. a part of a structure having some specific characteristic or function.
definitions.example: the spacious cooking area provided plenty of room for servants

definitions.text: 5. a part of an animal that has a special function or is supplied by a given artery or nerve.
6. the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.
definitions.example: the area of a rectangle , it was about 500 square feet in area

definitions.text: 1. place a value on; judge the worth of something.
2. charge (a person or a property) with a payment, such as a tax or a fine.
3. set or determine the amount of (a payment such as a fine).
4. estimate the value of (property) for taxation.
definitions.example: Our house hasn't been assessed in years

definitions.text: 1. take to be the case or to be true; accept without verification or proof.
definitions.example: I assume his train was late

definitions.text: 2. take on titles, offices, duties, responsibilities.
definitions.example: When will the new President assume office?

definitions.text: 3. take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect.
definitions.example: She assumed strange manners , The gods assume human or animal form in these fables

definitions.text: 4. take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person.
5. occupy or take on.
definitions.example: He assumes the lotus position

definitions.text: 6. seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession.
definitions.example: He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town

definitions.text: 7. make a pretence of.
definitions.example: She assumed indifference, even though she was seething with anger

definitions.text: 8. Christianity, obsolete; take up someone's soul into heaven.
definitions.example: This is the day when May was assumed into heaven

definitions.text: 9. put clothing on one's body.
definitions.example: The queen assumed the stately robes

definitions.text: 1. the power or right to give orders or make decisions.
definitions.example: he has the authority to issue warrants

definitions.text: 2. (usually plural) persons who exercise (administrative) control over others.
3. an expert whose views are taken as definitive.
definitions.example: he is an authority on corporate law

definitions.text: 4. freedom from doubt; belief in yourself and your abilities.
definitions.example: she spoke with authority

definitions.text: 5. an administrative unit of government.
6. official permission or approval.
definitions.example: authority for the program was renewed several times

definitions.text: 7. an authoritative written work.
definitions.example: this book is the final authority on the life of Milton

definitions.text: 1. obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
definitions.example: kept a fire extinguisher available , much information is available through computers , available in many colors , the list of available candidates is unusually long

definitions.text: 2. not busy; not otherwise committed.
definitions.example: he was not available for comment , he was available and willing to accompany her

definitions.text: 3. convenient for use or disposal.
definitions.example: the house is available after July 1

definitions.text: 1. financial assistance in time of need.
2. something that aids or promotes well-being.
3. a performance to raise money for a charitable cause.
1. derive a benefit from.
2. be beneficial for.
1. an abstract or general idea inferred or derived from specific instances.
1. originate (in).
2. have its essential character; be comprised or contained in; be embodied in.
definitions.example: The payment consists in food , What does love consist in?

definitions.text: 3. be consistent in form, tenor, or character; be congruous.
definitions.example: Desires are to be satisfied only so far as consists with an approved end

definitions.text: 4. be composed of.
definitions.example: What does this dish consist of?

definitions.text: 1. form or compose.
definitions.example: These constitute my entire belongings

definitions.text: 2. create and charge with a task or function.
3. to compose or represent.
4. set up or lay the groundwork for.
1. discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation.
2. the set of facts or circumstances that surround a situation or event.
definitions.example: the historical context

definitions.text: 1. a binding agreement between two or more persons that is enforceable by law.
2. (contract bridge) the highest bid becomes the contract setting the number of tricks that the bidder must make.
3. a variety of bridge in which the bidder receives points toward game only for the number of tricks he bid.
1. enter into a contractual arrangement.
2. engage by written agreement.
3. squeeze or press together.
definitions.example: the spasm contracted the muscle

definitions.text: 4. become smaller or draw together.
5. be stricken by an illness, fall victim to an illness.
6. make smaller.
definitions.example: The heat contracted the woollen garment

definitions.text: 7. compress or concentrate.
8. make or become more narrow or restricted.
9. reduce in scope while retaining essential elements.
1. make or cause to be or to become.
definitions.example: create a furor

definitions.text: 2. bring into existence.
definitions.example: The company was created 25 years ago , He created a new movement in painting

definitions.text: 3. pursue a creative activity; be engaged in a creative activity.
4. invest with a new title, office, or rank.
5. create by artistic means.
definitions.example: create a poem , Schoenberg created twelve-tone music , Picasso created Cubism

definitions.text: 6. create or manufacture a man-made product.
1. a collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn.
definitions.example: statistical data

definitions.text: 1. give a definition for the meaning of a word.
2. determine the essential quality of.
3. determine the nature of.
definitions.example: What defines a good wine?

definitions.text: 4. delineate the form or outline of.
definitions.example: The tree was clearly defined by the light , The camera could define the smallest object

definitions.text: 1. reason by deduction; establish by deduction.
2. obtain.
definitions.example: derive pleasure from one's garden

definitions.text: 3. come from.
definitions.example: The present name derives from an older form

definitions.text: 4. develop or evolve, especially from a latent or potential state.
5. come from; be connected by a relationship of blood, for example.
1. administer or bestow, as in small portions.
2. distribute or disperse widely.
3. make available.
definitions.example: The publisher wants to distribute the book in Asia

definitions.text: 4. give out.
5. cause to be distributed.
6. cause to become widely known.
7. spread throughout a given area.
definitions.example: the function distributes the values evenly

definitions.text: 8. be distributed or spread, as in statistical analyses.
definitions.example: Values distribute

definitions.text: 9. be mathematically distributive.
10. to arrange in a systematic order.
1. the system of production and distribution and consumption.
2. the efficient use of resources.
definitions.example: economy of effort

definitions.text: 3. frugality in the expenditure of money or resources.
definitions.example: the Scots are famous for their economy

definitions.text: 4. an act of economizing; reduction in cost.
definitions.example: it was a small economy to walk to work every day

definitions.text: 1. the totality of surrounding conditions.
definitions.example: he longed for the comfortable environment of his livingroom

definitions.text: 2. the area in which something exists or lives.
1. set up or found.
2. set up or lay the groundwork for.
definitions.example: establish a new department

definitions.text: 3. establish the validity of something, as by an example, explanation or experiment.
4. institute, enact, or establish.
5. bring about.
definitions.example: The trompe l'oeil-illusion establishes depth

definitions.text: 6. place.
7. use as a basis for; found on.
8. build or establish something abstract.
1. an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth.
definitions.example: an estimate of what it would cost

definitions.text: 2. a judgment of the qualities of something or somebody.
definitions.example: many factors are involved in any estimate of human life

definitions.text: 3. a document appraising the value of something (as for insurance or taxation).
4. a statement indicating the likely cost of some job.
definitions.example: he got an estimate from the car repair shop

definitions.text: 5. the respect with which a person is held.
1. judge tentatively or form an estimate of (quantities or time).
definitions.example: I estimate this chicken to weigh three pounds

definitions.text: 2. judge to be probable.
1. clearly apparent or obvious to the mind or senses.
definitions.example: evident hostility

definitions.text: 2. capable of being seen or noticed.
definitions.example: a clearly evident erasure in the manuscript

definitions.text: 1. commodities (goods or services) sold to a foreign country.
1. sell or transfer abroad.
definitions.example: we export less than we import and have a negative trade balance

definitions.text: 2. cause to spread in another part of the world.
definitions.example: The Russians exported Marxism to Africa

definitions.text: 1. anything that contributes causally to a result.
definitions.example: a number of factors determined the outcome

definitions.text: 2. an abstract part of something.
definitions.example: a key factor in her success

definitions.text: 3. any of the numbers (or symbols) that form a product when multiplied together.
4. one of two or more integers that can be exactly divided into another integer.
definitions.example: what are the 4 factors of 6?

definitions.text: 5. a businessman who buys or sells for another in exchange for a commission.
6. an independent variable in statistics.

7. (genetics) a segment of DNA that is involved in producing a polypeptide chain; it can include regions preceding and following the coding DNA as well as introns between the exons; it is considered a unit of heredity.
definitions.example: genes were formerly called factors

definitions.text: 1. resolve into factors.
definitions.example: a quantum computer can factor the number 15

definitions.text: 1. the commercial activity of providing funds and capital.
2. the branch of economics that studies the management of money and other assets.
3. the management of money and credit and banking and investments.
1. obtain or provide money for.
definitions.example: Can we finance the addition to our home?

definitions.text: 2. sell or provide on credit.
1. a group of symbols that make a mathematical statement.
2. directions for making something.
3. a conventionalized statement expressing some fundamental principle.
4. a representation of a substance using symbols for its constituent elements.
5. something regarded as a normative example.
definitions.example: his formula for impressing visitors

definitions.text: 6. a liquid food for infants.
7. (mathematics) a standard procedure for solving a class of mathematical problems.
definitions.example: he gave us a general formula for attacking polynomials

definitions.text: 1. a mathematical relation such that each element of one set is associated with at least one element of another set.
2. what something is used for.
definitions.example: the function of an auger is to bore holes

definitions.text: 3. the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.
definitions.example: the function of a teacher

definitions.text: 4. a relation such that one thing is dependent on another.
definitions.example: height is a function of age , price is a function of supply and demand

definitions.text: 5. a formal or official social gathering or ceremony.
definitions.example: it was a black-tie function

definitions.text: 6. a vaguely specified social event.
definitions.example: a seemingly endless round of social functions

definitions.text: 7. a set sequence of steps, part of larger computer program.
1. perform as expected when applied.
2. serve a purpose, role, or function.
definitions.example: The table functions as a desk

definitions.text: 3. perform duties attached to a particular office or place or function.
1. recognize as being; establish the identity of someone or something.
2. give the name or identifying characteristics of; refer to by name or some other identifying characteristic property.
3. consider (oneself) as similar to somebody else.
4. conceive of as united or associated.
5. identify as in botany or biology, for example.
6. consider to be equal or the same.
1. the financial gain (earned or unearned) accruing over a given period of time.
1. be a signal for or a symptom of.
definitions.example: These symptoms indicate a serious illness

definitions.text: 2. indicate a place, direction, person, or thing; either spatially or figuratively.
definitions.example: he indicated his opponents

definitions.text: 3. to state or express briefly.
definitions.example: indicated his wishes in a letter

definitions.text: 4. give evidence of.
definitions.example: The results indicate the need for more work

definitions.text: 5. suggest the necessity of an intervention; in medicine.
definitions.example: Tetracycline is indicated in such cases

definitions.text: 1. a human being.
2. a single organism.
1. being or characteristic of a single thing or person.
definitions.example: individual drops of rain , please mark the individual pages , they went their individual ways

definitions.text: 2. separate and distinct from others of the same kind.
definitions.example: mark the individual pages

definitions.text: 3. characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing.
definitions.example: an individual serving

definitions.text: 4. concerning one person exclusively.
definitions.example: we all have individual cars

definitions.text: 1. make sense of; assign a meaning to.
definitions.example: How do you interpret his behavior?

definitions.text: 2. give an interpretation or explanation to.
3. give an interpretation or rendition of.
4. create an image or likeness of.
5. restate (words) from one language into another language.
definitions.example: Can you interpret the speech of the visiting dignitaries?

definitions.text: 6. make sense of a language.
1. connect closely and often incriminatingly.
2. engage as a participant.
definitions.example: Don't involve me in your family affairs!

definitions.text: 3. have as a necessary feature or consequence; entail.
definitions.example: This decision involves many changes

definitions.text: 4. require as useful, just, or proper.
5. contain as a part.
definitions.example: Dinner at Joe's always involves at least six courses

definitions.text: 6. wrap.
definitions.example: The tower was involved in mist

definitions.text: 7. occupy or engage the interest of.
definitions.example: His story completely involved me during the entire afternoon

definitions.text: 8. make complex or intricate or complicated.
definitions.example: The situation was rather involved

definitions.text: 1. an important question that is in dispute and must be settled.
definitions.example: the issue could be settled by requiring public education for everyone , politicians never discuss the real issues

definitions.text: 2. one of a series published periodically.
definitions.example: she found an old issue of the magazine in her dentist's waitingroom

definitions.text: 3. the provision of something by issuing it (usually in quantity).
definitions.example: a new issue of stamps , the last issue of penicillin was over a month ago

definitions.text: 4. some situation or event that is thought about.
5. supplies (as food or clothing or ammunition) issued by the government.
6. the immediate descendants of a person.
definitions.example: he died without issue

definitions.text: 7. a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
8. the income arising from land or other property.
9. the becoming visible.
10. an opening that permits escape or release.

definitions.text: 11. the act of issuing printed materials.
1. prepare and issue for public distribution or sale.
2. circulate or distribute or equip with.
definitions.example: issue a new uniform to the children

definitions.text: 3. bring out an official document (such as a warrant).
4. come out of.
definitions.example: Water issued from the hole in the wall

definitions.text: 5. make out and issue.

2. concluding state of pregnancy; from the onset of labor to the birth of a child.
3. a political party formed in Great Britain in 1900; characterized by the promotion of labor's interests and the socialization of key industries.
4. productive work (especially physical work done for wages).
1. work hard.
2. strive and make an effort to reach a goal.
3. undergo the efforts of childbirth.
1. established by or founded upon law or official or accepted rules.

definitions.text: 3. having legal efficacy or force.

definitions.example: the legal profession

definitions.text: 5. allowed by official rules.
definitions.example: a legal pass receiver

definitions.text: 1. make laws, bills, etc. or bring into effect by legislation.
definitions.example: We cannot legislate how people's spend their free time

definitions.text: 1. a commissioned military officer in the United States Army or Air Force or Marines; below lieutenant colonel and above captain.
2. British statesman who was prime minister from 1990 until 1997 (born in 1943).
3. a university student who is studying a particular field as the principal subject.
definitions.example: she is a linguistics major

definitions.text: 4. the principal field of study of a student at a university.
definitions.example: her major is linguistics

definitions.text: 1. have as one's principal field of study.
definitions.example: She is majoring in linguistics

definitions.text: 1. of greater importance or stature or rank.
definitions.example: a major artist , a major role , major highways

definitions.text: 2. greater in scope or effect.
definitions.example: a major contribution , a major improvement , a major break with tradition , a major misunderstanding

definitions.text: 3. greater in number or size or amount.
definitions.example: a major portion (a majority) of the population , a major portion of the winnings

definitions.text: 4. of the field of academic study in which one concentrates or specializes.
definitions.example: his major field was mathematics

definitions.text: 5. of a scale or mode.
definitions.example: major scales , the key of D major

definitions.text: 6. of greater seriousness or danger.
definitions.example: a major earthquake , a major hurricane , a major illness

definitions.text: 7. of full legal age.
definitions.example: major children

definitions.text: 8. of the elder of two boys with the same family name.

definitions.text: 1. a way of doing something, especially a systematic way; implies an orderly logical arrangement (usually in steps).
1. come to pass.

definitions.text: 2. come to one's mind; suggest itself.

definitions.text: 3. to be found to exist.

definitions.text: 1. a proportion multiplied by 100.
1. an amount of time.

definitions.text: 2. one of three periods of play in hockey games.
3. a stage in the history of a culture having a definable place in space and time.

definitions.text: 4. the interval taken to complete one cycle of a regularly repeating phenomenon.
5. the monthly discharge of blood from the uterus of nonpregnant women from puberty to menopause.
6. a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations.
definitions.example: in England they call a period a stop

definitions.text: 7. a unit of geological time during which a system of rocks formed.
definitions.example: ganoid fishes swarmed during the earlier geological periods

definitions.text: 8. the end or completion of something.
definitions.example: death put a period to his endeavors , a change soon put a period to my tranquility

definitions.text: 1. a line of argument rationalizing the course of action of a government.
definitions.example: they debated the policy or impolicy of the proposed legislation

definitions.text: 2. a plan of action adopted by an individual or social group.

definitions.text: 3. written contract or certificate of insurance.

definitions.text: 1. a basic generalization that is accepted as true and that can be used as a basis for reasoning or conduct.
definitions.example: their principles of composition characterized all their works

definitions.text: 2. a rule or standard especially of good behavior.
definitions.example: a man of principle , he will not violate his principles

definitions.text: 3. a basic truth or law or assumption.
definitions.example: the principles of democracy

definitions.text: 4. a rule or law concerning a natural phenomenon or the function of a complex system.
definitions.example: the principle of the conservation of mass , the principle of jet propulsion

definitions.text: 5. rule of personal conduct.
6. (law) an explanation of the fundamental reasons (especially an explanation of the working of some device in terms of laws of nature).

definitions.text: 1. continue with one's activities.

definitions.text: 3. follow a procedure or take a course.

1. a particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

definitions.text: 2. a sustained phenomenon or one marked by gradual changes through a series of states.

definitions.text: 3. (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity; an operation that affects mental contents.

definitions.text: 2. subject to a process or treatment, with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

definitions.text: 4. institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against.

definitions.text: 1. require as useful, just, or proper.

definitions.text: 1. a self-contained part of a larger composition (written or musical).

definitions.text: 2. a very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope.

definitions.text: 2. a person who supplies information.

definitions.text: 5. a facility where something is available.

definitions.text: 2. lower (prices or markets).
definitions.example: The glut of oil depressed gas prices

definitions.text: 3. cause to drop or sink.
definitions.example: The lack of rain had depressed the water level in the reservoir

definitions.text: 4. press down.
5. lessen the activity or force of.
definitions.example: The rising inflation depressed the economy

definitions.text: 1. a minor short-term fight.
2. a casual or unexpected convergence.
definitions.example: there was a brief encounter in the hallway

definitions.text: 3. a casual meeting with a person or thing.
4. a hostile disagreement face-to-face.
1. come together.
2. come upon, as if by accident; meet with.
3. be beset by.
4. experience as a reaction.
5. contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle.
1. extraordinarily large in size or extent or amount or power or degree.
definitions.example: an enormous boulder , enormous expenses

definitions.text: 1. at ease in talking to others.
2. of the relatively near future.
definitions.example: the forthcoming holidays

definitions.text: 3. available when required or as promised.
definitions.example: federal funds were not forthcoming

definitions.text: 1. an elevated geological formation.
2. an inclined surface or roadway that moves traffic from one level to another.
1. have a tendency or disposition to do or be something; be inclined.
definitions.example: He inclined to corpulence

definitions.text: 2. bend or turn (one's ear) towards a speaker in order to listen well.
definitions.example: He inclined his ear to the wise old man

definitions.text: 3. lower or bend (the head or upper body), as in a nod or bow.
definitions.example: She inclined her head to the student

definitions.text: 4. be at an angle.
5. make receptive or willing towards an action or attitude or belief.
definitions.example: Their language inclines us to believe them

definitions.text: 1. an unreduced or unbroken completeness or totality.
2. moral soundness.
1. belonging to a thing by its very nature.
definitions.example: form was treated as something intrinsic, as the very essence of the thing- John Dewey

definitions.text: 2. situated within or belonging solely to the organ or body part on which it acts.
definitions.example: intrinsic muscles

definitions.text: 1. evoke or call forth, with or as if by magic.
2. cite as an authority; resort to.
definitions.example: He invoked the law that would save him , She invoked an ancient law

definitions.text: 3. request earnestly (something from somebody); ask for aid or protection.
1. a charge imposed and collected.
2. the act of drafting into military service.
1. impose and collect.
definitions.example: levy a fine

definitions.text: 2. cause to assemble or enlist in the military.
1. in like or similar manner.
definitions.example: some people have little power to do good, and have likewise little strength to resist evil- Samuel Johnson

definitions.text: 2. in addition.
3. equally.
1. despite anything to the contrary (usually following a concession).
1. despite anything to the contrary (usually following a concession).
1. not divisible by two.
2. not easily explained.
definitions.example: it is odd that his name is never mentioned

definitions.text: 3. an indefinite quantity more than that specified.
definitions.example: invited 30-odd guests

definitions.text: 4. beyond or deviating from the usual or expected.
definitions.example: had an odd name

definitions.text: 5. of the remaining member of a pair, of socks e.g..
6. not used up.
definitions.example: some odd dollars left

definitions.text: 1. currently happening.
definitions.example: an ongoing economic crisis

definitions.text: 1. sheet that forms a distinct (usually flat) section or component of something.
2. a committee appointed to judge a competition.
3. (law) a group of people summoned for jury service (from whom a jury will be chosen).
4. a group of people gathered for a special purpose as to plan or discuss an issue or judge a contest etc.
5. a pad placed under a saddle.

6. (computer science) a small temporary window in a graphical user interface that appears in order to request information from the user; after the information has been provided the user dismisses the box with `okay' or `cancel'.
7. electrical device consisting of an insulated panel containing switches and dials and meters for controlling other electrical devices.
definitions.example: he checked the instrument panel

definitions.text: 1. decorate with panels.
definitions.example: panel the walls with wood

definitions.text: 2. select from a list.
definitions.example: empanel prospective jurors

definitions.text: 1. continue to exist.
2. be persistent, refuse to stop.
definitions.example: he persisted to call me every night , The child persisted and kept asking questions

definitions.text: 3. stay behind.
1. affected manners intended to impress others.
2. a posture assumed by models for photographic or artistic purposes.
3. a deliberate pretense or exaggerated display.
1. introduce.
definitions.example: This poses an interesting question

definitions.text: 2. assume a posture as for artistic purposes.
definitions.example: We don't know the woman who posed for Leonardo so often

definitions.text: 3. pretend to be someone you are not; sometimes with fraudulent intentions.
definitions.example: She posed as the Czar's daughter

definitions.text: 4. behave affectedly or unnaturally in order to impress others.
5. put into a certain place or abstract location.
6. be a mystery or bewildering to.
1. (physics) opposition to magnetic flux (analogous to electric resistance).
2. a certain degree of unwillingness.
definitions.example: a reluctance to commit himself

definitions.text: 1. doubtful or suspect.
definitions.example: these so-called experts are no help

definitions.text: 1. free from ambiguity.
definitions.example: a straightforward set of instructions

definitions.text: 2. without evasion or compromise.
definitions.example: he is not being as straightforward as it appears

definitions.text: 3. without concealment or deception; honest.
definitions.example: straightforward in all his business affairs

definitions.text: 4. pointed directly ahead.
definitions.example: a straightforward gaze

definitions.text: 1. (of mental or physical states or experiences) experience or feel.
definitions.example: undergo a strange sensation , The chemical undergoes a sudden change

definitions.text: 2. go or live through.
3. accept or undergo, often unwillingly.
1. as a result of which.
2. by or through which.
definitions.example: the means whereby we achieved our goal
